intro: Melittis subcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf melittis, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
